metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35508 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: A flaw possibility of race condition and incorrect initialization of the process id was found in the Linux kernel child/parent process identification handling while filtering signal handlers. A local attacker is able to abuse this flaw to bypass checks to send any signal to a privileged process. It was discovered that a race condition existed that caused the Linux kernel to not properly restrict exit signal delivery. A local attacker could possibly use this to send signals to arbitrary processes.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> possibly Red Hat specific, but bug lists upstream commits, needs investigation sbeattie> The upstream commit is with respect to the race condition, not the improper initialization.
